byline.contributor: Edward Wong reported from Datong, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Mia Li, Adam Wu and Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.
byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and CHRIS BUCKLEY

abstract: China's decrease in coal consumption, which has mirrored economic decline, may mean carbon emissions have peaked and fossil fuel emissions-reductions could be attained ahead of 2030 goal; as world's largest polluter, country's climate policies and ability to develop clean energy has global impact.
lead_paragraph: The subject of greenhouse gas emissions will be on the table when President Obama hosts President Xi Jinping of China at the White House.

headline.main: Fading Coal Industry in China May Offer Chance to Aid Climate
headline.print_headline: Fading Coal Industry in China May Help Efforts to Slow Global Warming

snippet: The subject of greenhouse gas emissions will be on the table when President Obama hosts President Xi Jinping of China at the White House.

keywords.value: Carbon Caps and Emissions Trading Programs
keywords.name: subject
